page.title: 19CHILDRENS SPARE TIME
page.content: Children under five have a play group three mornings a week in the Institute. For children of school ge there is an adventure club. This is run by people from the Methodist chapel.In summer they sometimes go on trips. Boys over eleven can join scouts. There used to be cubs for the younger boys. There are all kinds of things for adults to do in their spare time. There are clubs for cricket, archery, a music society and the Buffs. They organise Scorton feast and help to run the hospital fete. They can also join teams to play darts or quoits in the pubs.
